subject: RE: [junit] RE: Abuse - Inappropriate Material - junit@yahoogroups.com  (KMM54613869V93979L0KM)
msgSnippet: I guess you missed my point... I m not talking about the annoying Yahoo ads appearing at the end of messages, I m talking about REAL SPAMMING, i.e. messages
messageBody:
I guess you missed my point... I'm not talking about the annoying Yahoo ads
appearing at the end of messages, I'm talking about REAL SPAMMING, i.e.
messages containing nothing else than banners, sent by a company calling
herself Mainan Elektronik, and even more annoying, Yahoo's unwillingness to
give us even a minimal protection against such abuse.

just to clarify things. I'd hate to have Yahoo on my "unwanted" list just
because of this ;-)

-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
Sent: woensdag 26 december 2001 21:55
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Cc: Yahoo! Groups
Subject: Re: [junit] RE: Abuse - Inappropriate Material -
junit@yahoogroups.com (KMM54613869V93979L0KM)


No, not necessarily. The Yahoo! group is fine. Yes, the ads are
annoying, but at least they are at the end of the messages. If someone
would like host a mailing list AND make it easy for the general public
to find and register at, then that's good. I'd rather be sure that we're
reaching a wide audience and Yahoo! helps to make that happen.

JBR.

Philippe Vanpeperstraete wrote:

>Dear all,
>
>This is the reaction I received from Yahoo about the spamming sent to our
>list recently. Any reactions? Time to look for a better platform?
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Yahoo! Groups [mailto:abuse@yahoogroups.com]
>Sent: woensdag 26 december 2001 20:13
>To: philippe.vanpeperstraete@...
>Subject: Re: Abuse - Inappropriate Material - junit@yahoogroups.com
>(KMM54613869V93979L0KM)
>
>
>Hello,
>
>Thank you for writing to Yahoo! Groups.
>
>Yahoo! Groups is free to both members and moderators. Our service is
>advertiser-supported and is partially sponsored by advertisements
>inserted within group messages.
>
>Groups is committed to offering you a high-quality, easy group
>service. As a business, we have two choices in paying for this
>service: one, charge members for its use, or two, include targeted
>text and HTML banner advertisements within messages sent to group
>members. Groups members have shown an overwhelming preference for a
>free, ad-supported service...and that's what we've provided.
>
>We are always looking for ways to improve Yahoo! Groups, and we will
>be sure to keep your questions in mind as we continue to make
>improvements to our service.
>
>Thank you again for contacting Yahoo! Customer Care.
>
>Regards,
>
>Yahoo! Customer Care
>
>For assistance with all Yahoo! services, please visit:
>
> http://help.yahoo.com/
>
>
